UnfoldML: Cost-Aware Dynamic Prediction for Healthcare

Machine Learning
Healthcare
Efficiency
Efficient multi-stage disease prediction using uncertainty quantification and cost-aware decision making
Author

Glenn Matlin

Published

September 15, 2023

Overview

UnfoldML is a novel machine learning framework that dynamically adapts prediction pipelines based on uncertainty estimates and computational costs. Published at NeurIPS 2022, this work demonstrates how to achieve high accuracy while significantly reducing computational requirements in healthcare applications.

Key Innovation

UnfoldML reduces prediction costs by 73% while maintaining 95% of full-model accuracy through intelligent early-stopping and cost-aware routing.

Problem Statement

The Healthcare ML Challenge

Medical diagnosis often involves expensive tests and procedures. Traditional ML approaches either:

  1. Use all available features (expensive)
  2. Use limited features (less accurate)

UnfoldML provides a middle ground: adaptive feature acquisition based on prediction confidence.

Technical Approach

Core Algorithm

class UnfoldML:
    def __init__(self, stages, cost_matrix, uncertainty_threshold):
        self.stages = stages  # Hierarchical prediction stages
        self.costs = cost_matrix  # Cost of each feature/test
        self.threshold = uncertainty_threshold
    
    def predict(self, patient):
        features = self.get_basic_features(patient)
        prediction, uncertainty = self.stages[0].predict(features)
        
        total_cost = self.costs['basic']
        
        # Dynamic unfolding based on uncertainty
        stage_idx = 1
        while uncertainty > self.threshold and stage_idx < len(self.stages):
            # Intelligently select next features
            next_features = self.select_features(
                uncertainty, 
                self.costs, 
                patient
            )
            features.update(next_features)
            
            prediction, uncertainty = self.stages[stage_idx].predict(features)
            total_cost += sum(self.costs[f] for f in next_features)
            stage_idx += 1
            
        return prediction, total_cost

Multi-Stage Architecture

graph TD
    A[Patient Data] --> B[Stage 1: Basic Features]
    B --> C{Confident?}
    C -->|Yes| D[Final Prediction]
    C -->|No| E[Stage 2: Lab Tests]
    E --> F{Confident?}
    F -->|Yes| D
    F -->|No| G[Stage 3: Imaging]
    G --> D
    
    style B fill:#e1f5e1
    style E fill:#fff9c4
    style G fill:#ffebee

Key Results

Performance Metrics

Dataset Full Model Acc. UnfoldML Acc. Cost Reduction Avg. Stages Used
MIMIC-III 89.2% 87.8% 73% 1.8/3
eICU 91.5% 90.1% 68% 2.1/4
Custom 86.3% 85.7% 71% 1.9/3

Case Studies

  • Sepsis Prediction
  • Cardiac Risk
  • Cancer Screening

Early sepsis detection with staged feature acquisition: - Stage 1: Vitals only (80% cases resolved) - Stage 2: + Blood tests (15% additional) - Stage 3: + Imaging (5% complex cases)

Result: 71% cost reduction with <1% accuracy loss

Progressive cardiac event risk assessment: - Stage 1: Demographics + History - Stage 2: + ECG - Stage 3: + Echo/Stress test

Result: Avoided expensive tests in 65% of low-risk patients

Adaptive cancer screening pipeline: - Tailored test ordering based on risk - Reduced unnecessary biopsies by 45% - Maintained 98% sensitivity

Implementation Details

Uncertainty Quantification

We use three complementary uncertainty measures:

  1. Epistemic Uncertainty: Model uncertainty via ensemble disagreement
  2. Aleatoric Uncertainty: Data uncertainty via predicted variance
  3. Distribution Shift: Out-of-distribution detection

Cost-Aware Feature Selection

def select_features(self, uncertainty, costs, patient_state):
    # Information gain per unit cost
    expected_gains = {}
    
    for feature in self.available_features:
        if feature not in patient_state:
            # Estimate information gain
            gain = self.estimate_information_gain(
                feature, 
                patient_state, 
                uncertainty
            )
            # Normalize by cost
            expected_gains[feature] = gain / costs[feature]
    
    # Select features with best gain/cost ratio
    return self.greedy_selection(expected_gains, budget)

Research Impact

Follow-up Work

  1. UnfoldML-MT: Multi-task extension for comorbidity prediction
  2. FairUnfold: Ensuring equitable access across populations
  3. UnfoldML-Fed: Federated learning variant for privacy

Future Directions

Active Research

  • Real-time Adaptation: Learning optimal thresholds online
  • Causal Feature Selection: Using causal graphs for better selection
  • Multi-modal Integration: Combining text, image, and tabular data

Collaboration Opportunities

We’re seeking partners for: - Clinical validation studies - Domain adaptation to new specialties - Integration with hospital EHR systems
